intro: Baccharis chaparensis, commonly known as Chapareño bush, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that are typically grouped in clusters. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing drought tolerance and resilience. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
